itemLabel: Walter Runciman, 1st Viscount Runciman of Doxford

wikipedia_page.main: Walter Runciman, 1st Viscount Runciman of Doxford,  (19 November 1870 – 14 November 1949) was a prominent Liberal and later National Liberal politician in the United Kingdom. His 1938 diplomatic mission to Czechoslovakia was key to the enactment of the British policy of appeasement of Nazi Germany preceding the Second World War.
